uniol.apt.adt.pn

Class Marking

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.adt.pn.Marking

  • public class Marking
extends java.lang.Object
    The Marking class represents the marking of a petri net. It stores the places of the net and the count of tokens on the places in a hashmap. At each access the consistency of the places of the marking is checked with the petri net.
    Author:
    Manuel Gieseking

    • Constructor Detail

      • Marking

        public Marking(PetriNet net)
        Constructor. Sets the tokencount of every place of the given petri net to zero.
        Parameters:
        net - - the net for that the marking is created.

      • Marking

        public Marking(Marking m)
        Copy-Constructor.
        Parameters:
        m - - the marking that serves as template for creating the copy.

      • Marking

        public Marking(PetriNet net,
               Marking m)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        net - The net for which the marking instance gets created.
        m - A marking from which the mapping from places to token is copied.
        Throws:
        StructureException - if the places of the given net and tokenmap do not fit.

      • Marking

        public Marking(PetriNet net,
               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> m)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        net - The net for which the marking instance gets created.
        m - A mapping from Place ids to tokens.
        Throws:
        StructureException - if the places of the given net and tokenmap do not fit.

      • Marking

        public Marking(PetriNet net,
               int... orderedTokenCounts)
        Set the Marking for the given net.
        Parameters:
        net - - the net the marking belongs to.
        orderedTokenCounts - - list of token count for the places in lexical order.
        Throws:
        StructureException - thrown if the size of places in the given net and the length of the list of tokens does not fit.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if a token count is less than zero.

      • fire

        @Deprecated
public Marking fire(Transition... t)
        Deprecated. Markings should be used immutably. Use fireTransitions instead.
        Fires the given transitions by changing this marking.
        Parameters:
        t - - the transitions that should be fired.
        Returns:
        this marking, changed by firing the transitions.

      • getToken

        public Token getToken(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the token count of the given place with the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - a string containing an id of a place in the corresponding net.
        Returns:
        a value representing the token count.
        Throws:
        NoSuchNodeException - thrown if the place with the given id does not belong to the net.

      • getToken

        public Token getToken(Place p)
        Returns the token count of the given place.
        Parameters:
        p - a place of the corresponding net.
        Returns:
        a value representing the token count.
        Throws:
        StructureException - thrown if the place belong to an other net.
        NoSuchNodeException - thrown if the place with the given id does not exists in the net.

      • ensureConsistency

        final void ensureConsistency()
        Used for ensuring the consistency of the marking. The function checks the place revision variable of the net and incase the marking has an earlier revision, the hashmap of the marking gets updated.

      • cover

        public Marking cover(Marking o)
        Check if this object covers the given other marking. If the other marking is covered, a new marking is returned with has suitable omegas added. Else, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        o - The marking that should be covered.
        Returns:
        A marking with added omegas, or null if this does not cover the other marking.

      • covers

        @Deprecated
public boolean covers(Marking o)
        Deprecated. Markings should be used immutably. Use cover instead.
        Check if this object covers the given other marking. If the other marking is covered, suitable omegas are added to this object.
        Parameters:
        o - The marking that should be covered.
        Returns:
        true if the given marking gets covered

      • hasOmega

        public boolean hasOmega()
        Check if the marking contains at least one omega.
        Returns:
        true if the mapping contains at least one omega token.
